titles.title: Furlough Prevention Act of 1995
To prevent paid furloughs of Federal and District of Columbia employees during periods of lapsed appropriations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight. subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

bill.summary: 12/12/1995--Introduced. Furlough Prevention Act of 1995 - Prohibits an officer or employee of the Federal Government or of the District of Columbia government from being furloughed due to any period of lapsed appropriations. Provides that employment during such period shall create an obligation by the government involved to compensate such an officer or employee after the end of the period at his or her standard rate.
